info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HARRISON...CENTRAL JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Wintersville, or 11 miles northeast of Cadiz, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Weirton, Steubenville, Toronto, Wintersville, Mingo Junction, Follansbee, Hooverson Heights, New Cumberland, Hopedale, Bergholz, Amsterdam, Richmond, Empire, Stratton, Bloomingdale, Unionport, Brentwood, Sun Valley, and East Steubenville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
